text.0: sing forth a hymn sublime and solemn grateful to glorious varuṇa imperial ruler.
text.1: who hath struck out like one who slays the victim earth as a skin to spread in front of sūrya.
text.2: in the treetops the air he hath extended put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses.
text.3: set intellect in hearts fire in the waters siurya in heaven and soma on the mountain.
text.4: varuṇa lets the big cask opening downward flow through the heaven and earth and airs midregion.
text.5: therewith the universes sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.
text.6: when varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky the land and earth to her foundation.
text.7: then straight the mountains clothe them in the raincloud the heroes putting forth their vigour loose them.
text.8: i will declare this mighty deed of magic of glorious varuṇa the lord immortal.
text.9: who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the sun as with a measure.
text.10: none verily hath ever let or hindered this the most wise gods mighty deed of magic.
text.11: whereby with all their flood the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.
text.12: if we have sinned against the man who loves us have ever wronged a brother friend or comrade.
text.13: the neighbour ever with us or a stranger o varuṇa remove from us the trespass.
text.14: if we as gamesters cheat at play have cheated done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose.
text.15: cast all these sins away like loosened fetters and varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.
